H7950.def: = frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity

H7019.def: = hot season of the year, opposite of {L:חֹרֶף<SDBH:חֹרֶף>}; ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

H4306.def: = water coming down from the sky, which is indispensable for sustaining human life, but can be both refreshing and destructive

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H5000.def: = state in which humans or parts of their body are considered physically attractive

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H5110.def: = process by which objects shake or move back and forth ◄ because of being unstable or when agitated by an outside force

H6833.def: = small bird, speckled brown in color; found in abundance around towns and settlements; lives on grass and grain; ◄ Passer domesticus, Passer hispaniolensis, and Passer moabiticus; ► clean and can therefore be eaten

H5774.def: = process by which an object moves through the air

H1866.def: = process by which a liquid flows slowly, forming large drops

H2600.def: = action by which someone performs an event as a favor, without expecting a reward or remuneration for it

H7045.def: = actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it

H7752.def: = strip of leather or length of cord fastened to a handle, ► used for beating a person or urging on an animal

H5483.def: = large domesticated solid-hoofed quadruped; stockily built in comparison to today's horses, with shorter heads and thicker necks; about 122–142 cm tall, and 2.1 m long; its coat varies from dark to pale brown; it eats plants; ◄ Equus caballus; ► used in battle, both to ride and for pulling chariots; ≈ symbolic of military might; associated with the sun, which was said to ride across the sky in a chariot

H4964.def: = short bar, ◄ usually made of metal, ► placed in the mouth of a horse; its ends, which project from the mouth of the animal, are attached to ropes or leather straps that fit over the head as the {L:bridle<SDBH:רֶסֶן>}; used to steer the horse; ≈ associated with control and, indirectly, with lack of wisdom

H2543.def: = domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see {L:עַיִר<SDBH:עַיִר>}; female see {L:אָתֹון<SDBH:אָתֹון>}

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H1460.def: = the rear part of the human body, especially from the neck to the bottom

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H6030.def: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H7096.def: = causative action by which humans remove part of an object with a sharp tool

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H2555.def: = pattern of behavior by which humans behave aggressively towards other humans, ► usually in order to enrich oneself in one way or another

H7971.def: = causative action by which humans or deities commission one or more agents to go to a certain individual or place in order to perform a certain task

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H6455.def: = state in which humans or animals are disabled in one of their legs or feet, ► and so have difficulty walking

H7785.def: = the upper part of the leg of humans and animals

H1809.def: = process by which the height of a body of water is diminished ◄ due to a drought

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H4773.def: = weapon consisting of two strings with a {L:pouch<SDBH:כַּף>} in the middle;◄ made of leather; ► a {L:stone<SDBH:אֶבֶן>} is placed in the pouch, the sling is twirled and one string released to propel the stone; used to hunt or to chase away wild animals, or to attack an enemy

H3519.def: = position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H2336.def: = plant with thorns; ► useless; ≈ regarded as ugly and useless

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H7910.def: = state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol

H4912.def: = an utterance, often in poetic style, that has a specific message, such as an oracle, words of advice, wisdom, or mockery

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H7228.def: = state in which an object is very large in size

H2490.def: = action by which priests disqualify themselves for religious service ◄ by unlawful behavior

H7936.def: = action by which humans make their services available to other humans for a limited amount of time and in return for payment

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H3611.def: = relatively small light brown domestic animal, feeding on anything from household refuse to animal carcasses and excreta; ◄ |iCanis familiaris putiatini|i*; ► extremely unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten, though used for hunting and for watching sheep; ≈ considered almost as unclean as a {L:pig<SDBH:חֲזִיר>}; associated with all sorts of uncleanness, aggression, greediness, low status; used as derogatory term for male shrine prostitutes

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H200.def: = state of being regarded as foolish, ◄  because of lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, talking too much, and being unable to conceal one's temper

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H3684.def: = state of absence of wisdom, which manifests itself in excessive anger, talking too rashly and too much, sinful behavior, and laziness, ► and results in poverty, shame, punishment, and trouble and grief for other people; ≈ foolishness is thought to reside in a person's {L:heart<SDBH:לֵב>}; the behavior and treatment of fools is often compared to that of animals

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H7826.def: exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male {L:lion<SDBH:אֲרִי>} that is no longer living with its pride and wanders around alone

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H996.def: = the area separating two or mores locations

H7339.def: = central part of a city where people meet and where civic and commercial activities take place, usually at the intersection of streets and roads

H1817.def: = a hinged barrier at the entrance to a town, building, or room; ◄ usually made out of wood, but occasionally also out of metal; ► provides or prevents access; ≈ sometimes associated with vulnerability

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H6735.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing in the form of an image or a drawing; ► functioning in non-sanctioned rituals or as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H4296.def: = a low platform standing on four legs, a bit longer than the length of a man, and about 70-80 centimeters wide; ► used by people of means to sit or sleep on

H2934.def: = action by which humans cause themselves to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H6747.def: = a flat dish; ► for holding food for eating or serving

H3811.def: = action by which humans spend all their forces on a certain activity

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H2940.def: = the flavor characteristics of certain types of food

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H3611.def: = relatively small light brown domestic animal, feeding on anything from household refuse to animal carcasses and excreta; ◄ |iCanis familiaris putiatini|i*; ► extremely unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten, though used for hunting and for watching sheep; ≈ considered almost as unclean as a {L:pig<SDBH:חֲזִיר>}; associated with all sorts of uncleanness, aggression, greediness, low status; used as derogatory term for male shrine prostitutes

H241.def: = one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

H2131.def: = chains or shackles attached to the feet of a captive ► in order to restrain their movements

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H2671.def: = pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment

H7411.def: = action by which humans cause (other) humans or objects to move in a particular direction, usually with force

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H7453.def: = the non-verbal sounds made by a large group of people in response to a situation, either positively or negatively

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H589.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H7832.def: = action by which humans give expression to a friendly attitude, joy and amusement with the gestures and sounds that normally accompany it; ≈ this is normally regarded as a good thing, especially when done with restraint, whereas a lack of restraint is often associated with foolishness

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H3518.def: = process by which a fire comes to an end, either in a natural way or by force

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H7279.def: = action by which humans speak with anger and resentment

H4066.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

H8367.def: = process by which stormy waters stop moving

H6352.def: = a lightweight black carbon material, ◄ made by heating wood in an environment devoid of air, ► and used as fuel

H6086.def: = any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H4066.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity

26.gl: to kindle > to cause to get worse

H7279.def: = action by which humans speak with anger and resentment

H3859.def: meaning unsure; possibly: = things that are eaten with greed and pleasure

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H2315.def: = area enclosed by walls or partitions, floor, and ceiling; ◄ part of building

H990.def: = front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

H3701.def: = silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins

H6823.def: = action by which humans or deities watch attentitvely to monitor people and places

H2789.def: = container ◄ made of baked clay; ► used for household activities, in sacrificial rituals, and for the storage of documents; ≈ regarded as of low value

H1814.def: = process by which an object is affected or consumed by fire

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H5234.def: = process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

H7896.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4820.def: = action by which humans cause other humans to believe something that is not true; ► the result can be dangerous or destructive to what was once a trusting relationship

10.gl: to pretend to be a stranger

H2603.def: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H8441.def: = state in which an event is considered utterly wrong and detestable

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3680.def: = state or process by which a surface is covered by another object, ► often making this surface more or less invisible

H4860.def: = action with which someone misleads or deceives another person

H1540.def: = action by which someone takes off his/her clothes, either entirely or in part, ► as a result of which that person becomes naked or improperly dressed, ≈ which is considered a shameful thing to do

H5307.def: = process by which humans, animals, or objects move from a higher level to a lower level, typically at a high speed and without control

H1556.def: = causative action by which humans cause an object to move by turning it over and over

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H1790.def: literally: crushed; hence: = state in which someone is the victim of suffering and humiliation ◄ which feels as if one has been crushed with a heavy object

H2509.def: = state in which an object has a relatively even and regular surface, free from perceptible projections or lumps or indentations; ≈ often associated with danger and insincerity

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4072.def: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to fail in their efforts,◄ as if by giving them a violent push to make them stumble and fall
